intro: Triumfetta clivorum subsp. brevipetala, commonly known as the short-petioled triumfetta, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous shrub characterized by its simple, ovate leaves with short petioles. The flowers are typically small and clustered in dense inflorescences, often with five petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats. This subspecies is notable for its adaptive features that allow it to flourish in arid environments.
